statements: SELECT * FROM EmployeeInformation;
SELECT name, department FROM EmployeeInformation WHERE employee_id = 101;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeInformation WHERE department = 'HR';
SELECT name, contact_details FROM EmployeeInformation WHERE employee_id > 100;
SELECT department, COUNT(*) as total_employees FROM EmployeeInformation GROUP BY department;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeInformation WHERE department='Sales' ORDER BY name ASC
SELECT name, department FROM EmployeeInformation WHERE employee_id > 100 ORDER BY employee_id DESC
SELECT employee_id, name, department FROM EmployeeInformation WHERE employee_id BETWEEN 50 AND 100
SELECT MAX(employee_id) AS max_id, COUNT(*) AS total_employees FROM EmployeeInformation WHERE department='Human Resources'
SELECT DISTINCT department FROM EmployeeInformation
SELECT * FROM Employee;
SELECT name, department FROM Employee ORDER BY department ASC;
SELECT employee_id, name, department FROM Employee WHERE department = 'IT';
SELECT name, contact_number FROM Employee WHERE contact_number LIKE '+1%' ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT department_name, manager_name, location FROM Department;
SELECT * FROM Employee WHERE department='HR' ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT employee_id, name, department FROM Employee WHERE department='Finance' AND contact_number LIKE '123%';
SELECT employee_id, name, department FROM Employee WHERE department='Sales' OR department='Marketing';
SELECT e.name AS employee_name, d.department_name AS department_name FROM Employee e INNER JOIN Department d ON e.department=d.department_name;
SELECT department_name, COUNT(*) AS num_employees FROM Employee GROUP BY department_name HAVING COUNT(*) > 3;
SELECT * FROM Employees;
SELECT name, department FROM Employees WHERE department = 'HR';
SELECT name, contact_number FROM Employees ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT * FROM Departments WHERE location = 'New York';
SELECT department_name, manager FROM Departments ORDER BY department_id;
SELECT * FROM Employees;
SELECT name, department FROM Employees WHERE id = 1;
SELECT department_name, manager FROM Departments ORDER BY department_id DESC;
SELECT name, contact_number FROM Employees JOIN Contacts ON Employees.id = Contacts.employee_id;
SELECT DISTINCT department_name, location FROM Departments;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, department FROM employees WHERE department = 'IT';
SELECT id, name FROM departments ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT * FROM contacts WHERE email LIKE '%@gmail.com%';
SELECT * FROM managers WHERE id = 'abc123';
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department = 'HR';
SELECT id, name, department FROM employees WHERE name LIKE 'A%' ORDER BY department DESC;
SELECT e.name, e.department, c.phone_number FROM employees e JOIN contacts c ON e.id = c.employee_id WHERE e.department = 'Engineering' ORDER BY e.name ASC;
SELECT d.name AS department_name, m.name AS manager_name FROM departments d JOIN managers m ON d.manager_id = m.id;
SELECT e.name AS employee_name, c.email AS employee_email FROM employees e JOIN contacts c ON e.id = c.employee_id WHERE e.department = 'Finance';
SELECT * FROM Employees WHERE department = 'HR';
SELECT employee_name, department FROM Employees WHERE employee_id = 1;
SELECT employee_name, email FROM Employees WHERE department = 'IT' ORDER BY employee_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM Addresses WHERE postal_code = '12345';
SELECT employee_name, contact_type FROM Employees JOIN Contacts ON Employees.employee_id = Contacts.employee_id WHERE Contacts.contact_info = 'john.doe@example.com';
SELECT employee_name, department FROM Employees WHERE department = 'IT'
SELECT * FROM Addresses INNER JOIN Employees ON Addresses.employee_id = Employees.employee_id WHERE city = 'New York'
SELECT employee_name, salary_amount FROM Employees INNER JOIN Salaries ON Employees.employee_id = Salaries.employee_id WHERE salary_amount > 50000
SELECT employee_name, contact_type, contact_info FROM Employees INNER JOIN Contacts ON Employees.employee_id = Contacts.employee_id WHERE contact_type = 'Email'

SELECT employee_name, department, salary_amount FROM Employees INNER JOIN Salaries ON Employees.employee_id = Salaries.employee_id INNER JOIN Departments ON Employees.department = Departments.department_name
